  • Method Details

    • accepts

      public boolean accepts(Parse parse)
      Description copied from class: ParserCombinator
      Whether or not this parser will accept the provided input.

      This method fires of the entire process of parsing by invoking the ParserCombinator.matches(Parse) method.

      It will also commit the stream afterwards if it was the root parser.

      Overrides:
      accepts in class ParserCombinator

    • addAllKeywordsInScopeTo

      public void addAllKeywordsInScopeTo(Set<String> keywords, Set<String> scopesSeen)
      It's subtle, but when asking a scoped parser for all keywords "in scope", we're asking for all keywords in the scope it's being referenced from.

      If we were to add all keywords within its own scope, then the keywords list for the root scope would end up containing all keywords in the grammar. For instance, a Cobol program would know about all SQL-related keywords found in an EXEC SQL. This is not what we want.

      Instead what we need is to add all leading keywords of our own scope. This should give the parent scope just enough information about tokens it probably should know about, without telling it about all tokens. Taking the Cobol program example again, it would now only know about the markers for the overall structure of the program, and little else.

      Overrides:
      addAllKeywordsInScopeTo in class FutureParser

    • addAllLeadingKeywordsTo

      public void addAllLeadingKeywordsTo(Set<String> keywords, Set<String> scopesSeen)
      Description copied from class: ParserCombinator
      Add all leading keywords in scope to the given set.

      By default this leaves the set untouched.

      Overrides:
      addAllLeadingKeywordsTo in class FutureParser

    • allowsKeywords

      public boolean allowsKeywords()
      Description copied from class: ParserCombinator
      Whether or not this parser allows keywords to be passed through its scope.

      By default this returns true.

      Overrides:
      allowsKeywords in class ParserCombinator
